Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
Step to Reproduce: 1. Check the UI then compared with the product design document and software design document
Expected Result: Ensure all the UI are displayed and match with the requirement

Test Case Name: Verify add one item to cart
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
Step to Reproduce: 1. Click on the "add item" button from a selected item
Expected Result: Ensure the total selected item should show  "1" in cart with details of the item

Test Case Name: Verify add multiple item to cart
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
Step to Reproduce:
1. Click on the "add item" button from a selected item
2. Click on the "+" button as much as the total items user need
Expected Result:
1. Ensure the total item of the selected item should show the "expected number" in cart with details of the item 
2. Ensure the message are displayed "Item has been added to your cart"

Test Case Name: Verify add item to cart exceed than the available stock
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
Step to Reproduce: 1. Click on the "add item" button from a selected item more than the available stock
Expected Result:
1. Ensure the total selected item should show  the "expected number" in cart with details of the item
2. Ensure that was not able to increase the quantity to more than the available stock

Test Case Name: Verify edit total items by decrease the quantity at least 1
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
3. More than 2 items are selected
Step to Reproduce: 1. Click on the "-" button from a selected item
Expected Result:
1. Ensure the total item of the selected item should show the "expected number" in cart with details of the item 
2. Ensure the message are displayed "Total has been updated"

Test Case Name: Verify edit total items to zero
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
3. More than 1 items are selected
Step to Reproduce: 1. Click on the "-" button until the total items showing "0" number
Expected Result: Ensure the selected item and the total item should be removed from the cart

Test Case Name: Verify edit total items by decrease the quantity less than 0
Precondition:
1. User already login
2. Open items page
3. More than 1 items are selected
Step to Reproduce:
1. Click on the "-" button until the total items showing "0" number
2. Click on the "-" button again
Expected Result:
1. Ensure that was not able to decrease the quantity to less than 0 
2. Ensure the selected item and the total item should be removed from the cart
